website_summaries.verdict: An economical router designed for those who are frequently on the go.
pros: Convenient travel router is small and portable
Router makes it easy to convert a wired network to a wireless network or bridge an existing wireless network in just minutes
Delivers outstanding range at a budget-friendly price
cons: Internet connection frequently cuts in and out
May slow down internet speed when in use

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This item is horrible, poor-quality junk. Do not buy it. I suggest you go to CL and look for a second-hand "good" router instead of purchasing this product. The Wifi connection is unstable and the signal drops constantly. Normally, upon losing signal, the device resets itself and the connection is reestablished. However, after a few times of crashing, the connection drops and something happens to the router's configuration. At this point, any attempt to connect to the wifi network is futile -it issues an error message saying the password is incorrect. Then, the only alternative is to reset the router to default configuration. This happens often. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Cort

customer_reviews.title: Showed Promise, but Didn't Make It
customer_reviews.text: Showed some promise when I got it. I set it up quite easily by adding it to the wireless network. The connection kept dropping. Spent a day trouble shooting. I connected with ethernet cable and it still behaved erratic and it was harder to connect to the network. Today it did not charge any longer. Tried a different cable to see if that is the problem. Returning it. Read many of the reviews and agree with software being complicated.
customer_reviews.author: despond

customer_reviews.title: Works on a Plane - very small and light
customer_reviews.text: Have used in several scenarios and it always connects. I use it so my IoT devices can connect even to complex login scenarios, like at hotels. I have even used it with Go go servers on a plane. This means I can connect my phone and PC using only one connect. You can only store ONE network connection at a time... so when I travel between work and home, I have to reset the link each time. It would be much better if it would remember multiple setups and look for whatever is available. Love the size and it is so light, I carry it always. Have not tried the USB option yet.
customer_reviews.author: DanH

customer_reviews.title: Configuration and performance issues in AP mode
customer_reviews.text: Configuring this device for use in AP mode is difficult. The instructions are not clear and the user interface is not intuitive compared to other travel routers at the same price. Once configured, the performance was terrible. This is not just compared to connecting directly to the hotel Wi-Fi, but even compared to two other travel routers. Not sure how this device performs in wired mode, never got that far. It must perform in both modes and be much easier to configure. I will be returning this device.
customer_reviews.author: GrumpyDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Worked 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Lost my previous HooToo, loved it for repeating hotel wifi and allowing all my devices to connect after connecting just the one HooToo device to the wifi. Worked well for chromecast and google home (use a mini for lullabies to help my daughter fall asleep). Didn't hesitate to get this newer version when I lost the older one. It worked the same way for a couple of days, but then the internet speed dropped to a dial-up crawl, or no internet at all. After lots of resetting, re-configuring, and speed tests across multiple networks, decided the HooToo was the issue. In the trash it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little NAS converter if that is what you need.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is awesome! I wanted to convert a 5 Terrabyte USB 3.0 into a NAS drive. Took all of about 15 minutes to hook it up and configure it and I can see the entire 5 TB, not just the 4TB in the spec. Basically, for a total of about $140 I have a drive that can be seen on the entire network. Should note, I have it connected via the RJ45 port directly into my router. No issues streaming Hi Def content over the network off the drive.
customer_reviews.author: A guy in CA

customer_reviews.title: Useful travel companion
customer_reviews.text: Works fine and makes for a super lightweight and handy travel tool. But, it has a very weak CPU, and as a result if you’re sharing WiFi-to-wifi, the speed will be reduced considerably (as much as half) so use a wired network if possible and be aware of the limitations of such a small cpu. Update: the vendor (Sunvalley Brands) keeps trying to bribe me into changing my review by offering a refund in exchange for a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Yocum

customer_reviews.title: Out of date and not user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: The app recommended in the user manual is no longer available and my TripMate Nano does not work well with the TripMate Plus app available on the apple store. I have been unsuccessful in upgrading to the new firmware version. I am out of the return window (purchased in August for work; need it now; hadn't taken the time to play with it). The red HooToo was highly recommended by a course instructor, but I opted for the Nano to save money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: duck mom

customer_reviews.title: 1) This is the same set up in my hotel ...
customer_reviews.text: 1) This is the same set up in my hotel room to support 5 devices without paying through the nose against the usual 3 devices free Wi-Fi limitations:  2) Since it is getting harder to get wired ethernet in hotel rooms these days, I have no choice but to use the repeater mode and it is indeed won't be a fast connection to share with the rest of the devices. 3) Make sure you get the latest firmware to get full support most hotel's captive portal mode. Just follow this reviewer:  to scan for the correct hotel SSID.
customer_reviews.author: smpchan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device.  Might wanna look for better instructions, though.
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. Now I can access to the internet in my smartphone at work, where there's only wired access. Bit of advice, though. Following just the included instructions in the manual might be a bit confusing. I was starting to get a little bit frustrated at the fact that I couldn't get the AP mode to work, and I started to think I got a defective unit, but luckily I solved it. I recommend to visit HooToo¡s website and download the "HT-Nano Basic Setup" PDF file. You can't fail with that, follow the instructions on that file and you'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: MacJunegrandTop Contributor: DC Comics

customer_reviews.title: you do the HooToo you do so well
customer_reviews.text: Traveling. everyone wants to use the hotel wifi. Everyone and all their devices (tablets, phones, computers). Instead of everyone tediously entering the wifi info, YOU login the HooToo Nano, once, and everyone else uses the same setting they used last night. Saves you a ton of tech support and maybe some money on extra connections. Only downside is the software is not great, not intuitive, but you can live with it. I've only used the web interface; there is a free app on the Apple Store that seems to work well (in my limited experience). Media streaming also works well.
customer_reviews.author: Reuel

customer_reviews.title: You will get a better satisfaction experience with this model than the newer i promise
customer_reviews.text: o))) 2️⃣☠️📣💣💥i give this product 6 stars actually cause it has a usb extra storage to act as a cloud drive a wifi to wifi bouncer and Ethernet port to connect if u want wired and so many extra little features. o))) 2️⃣☠️📣💣💥the newer model TAKES ALL these good features out and is crappy i suggest you dont get it and stick with the older model you get a better satisfaction experience i say
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P Charles

customer_reviews.title: Stars for the ease to get it up and running but....
customer_reviews.text: That's the only reason it even has stars. Very easy to get up and running, just needed to download the app to set it up. Otherwise its a very slow connection. A direct wireless connection to the network offers me 20mbps while using the hoot on the same network gives me 1.5mpbs. I don't see this being useful when I need to connect multiple devices to the hootoo travel router. I am thinking about returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Taoist Monk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but slow.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to travel with and tested it before leaving. On a 100Mbps network, the best I could get when connecting to this via wifi was about 15Mbps. Swapped it out for the tp-link travel router instead, which is getting 80Mbps over wifi, which is more what I was expecting. Overall, if you are OK with those speeds, it's an inexpensive and effective device. But 15Mbps is pretty slow these days..
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to set up and took me maybe about 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to set up and took me maybe about 3 minutes to set everything up. There is a dedicated page within the router which enables to you to choose between static or dynamic address as well as extending wifi connections, which I found extremely useful. The USB port also supports my 1TB hard drive and allows me to access those files using an android dedicated program! I am extremely satisfied with this purchase and Hootoo's support was extremely quick in helping me with issues that arose while I updated the firmware. They sent me a replacement as mine broke while updating the firmware as the power on this device was disconnected by my charge port being unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Pringles

customer_reviews.title: Would not stay up
customer_reviews.text: After much playing I found the settings had to be set in a specific order or would not save. When setup, the device would stay active for a few days then disappear from my network. I could get into the device GUI by IP but it would not re-appear on my PC's SMB/DLNA listing without a full wipe and reset. I was trying to set it up as a mini USB NAS. Worked for a couple days then would drop. Ended up just getting a Raspberry Pi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing. Sadly most hotels I've been in lately have gotten rid of the ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic, I've had to do a lot of traveling for work and having this simple device to just walk into a hotel-room and plug in... Makes setting up my little network in the room so much easier than dealing with Hotel sign-ins and the slow process that it is. I usually have my laptop, Google Chrome, Kindle, and Mobile phone paired up to this within seconds of getting in the room. Sadly the last few times I've been in hotels they are often taking out the wired ethernet causing this time/hassle -saving unit to become defunct :(
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hughes

customer_reviews.title: but nice to know the technology is there if I should ...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple device and it works! I needed this to create a network among Nook Simple Touch and Amazon Fire tablets to score matches on a range with no power or internet service. I used an external USB battery to supply power. With this, I can sync all the devices to update match info, registrations, and scores and have final results all done within minutes of the close of the match. It has additional capabilities (shared storage via thumbdrive, ability to re-broadcast internet from an ethernet cable) that I probably will never use, but nice to know the technology is there if I should find a need. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A $20 wifi portable router that works great!
customer_reviews.text: This unit, thought it does not look very impressive works pretty darn good. All I need to keep get it going is a usb power source and boom I have a wifi router(connects to existing wifi or rj45 cable) , range extender, and usb access. I have to say it works great I have full internet access as well as access to any usb storage device I plug into it. Thumb drive, hard disk etc.. this allows full access from a phone or laptop to those files for download, view or stream. I would recomended to anyone that travels and as it will help with those weak hotel wifi signals. At under $20 it's a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Root

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Router w/ Hidden SSID
customer_reviews.text: 4th purchase of this router. Have never had an issue with them & been using for over ~5yrs. (They are small and can be hard to keep track of, at times). Installed WRT w/o issues. In my occupation, alot of people use this router.
customer_reviews.author: jmahaffey09

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough to do the job.
customer_reviews.text: This does not seem to have quite as strong a signal as the TP-Link, of similar dimensions, also sold here on Amazon. It also does not come with a wall-wart and the slick packaging either. But it gets the job done well enough. The menu system for setting it up is not great but after redoing it a few times with slightly different settings (in Bridge mode to extend my wireless network a bit further) it has continued to work reliably for a weeks now. The TP-Link I bought before this unit had the habit of needing to be rebooted every 24 hours. This one does not.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Clearwater

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travelers!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what can I say! This travel router is the best. I travel six months out of every year and some places I go to only have wired internet. Thats great if you only have one device like a laptop. For me, I have several wireless devices and this easily allowed me to hook them all up to internet. The setup was a breeze and within minutes I was on the fly browsing!
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Keith

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, even for wireless bridge. The instructions ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple setup, even for wireless bridge. The instructions take you through step by step. I was able to complete the setup on my Android phone in just a few minutes. It is even smaller than I thought. It only comes with a USB cable, not a wall charger, so if you are using it for something other than plugging it into your computer, plan on having a power source.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Too high-tech for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a basic "connect and use" router... This was NOT it. I read reviews and asked questions but they must have been written by people with a little bit of an understanding of these. I could not use this on my work laptop as I couldn't plug anything into it... In order for it to work, I had to plug it into a regular laptop and THEN it would work on my work laptop, iPad or other devices. Since I didn't bring two laptops with me, I couldn't use it. I would return it if I could but I have been overseas for three months so I believe ?I missed the deadline.
customer_reviews.author: Fit&Fab!

customer_reviews.title: Completely unusable, do not buy, repeated disconnects.
customer_reviews.text: Completely unusable, do not buy. I bought this device to turn the wired connection at my desk into a wireless network so that I could connect mobile devices onto the LAN. This device in both the default configuration and after customizing it would allow the mobile devices to connect but then would cause extremely slow connection speeds and would continually drop the network connection. This was testing with three different Samsung mobile devices, S5/S7edge/S8 and confirmed with a Dell laptop with Intel NIC. Perhaps this is a defective unit but I would not risk my money on this product again. I think I will be getting a simple wireless router from TP-Link instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Defective unit?
customer_reviews.text: I suspect that I received a defective unit. Despite testing this with a smartphone, MacBook Pro, Windows 7 PC, and a Chromebook, aI have not been able to hold onto the signal that the HooToo TripMate Nano is emitting (not for more than 30 seconds or so, at any rate). Moreover, while scanning for available wireless networks, sometimes the TripMate Nano shows up, and sometimes it's completely missing. At first, I thought I was doing something incorrectly, so I read, reread, and re-reread the instructions (which are clearly written by someone for whom English is a second language). Nope. The bottom line is that this thing just isn't working. I guess I'll have to return it, but what a hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Hey Vin

customer_reviews.title: it seems like a nice
customer_reviews.text: Not for use as a Ethernet to WiFi bridge... I bought this wanting to hook up my Sony Blu-ray to the internet, which only has an Ethernet port. For some reason, the Ethernet port on the HooToo only supports connections to a modem for the purposes of broadcasting WiFi. To be fair, it kind of says this in the description (The Ethernet port can only be used as a WAN input port), however stating that the device can be used as a 'bridge' is a bit misleading. Otherwise, if you only need to use this device to broadcast/extend WiFi, it seems like a nice, small router with an easy setup interface.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Setup was quick and simple, but...
customer_reviews.text: Setup was quick and simple. My complaint is where I will ever use it - because with it in place, it took a 57mbps (down) / 6mbps (up) wireless connection the hotel provided down to 1mbps (down) / 0.57mbps (up). I removed all encryption and was able to get it to about 4mbps (down). I've only tried this at one hotel and plan to try another soon. Will hope to update at that point. This test was running the device in "bridge" mode. My guess it will do much better when transforming a wired connection into a wireless one.
customer_reviews.author: Mark's valuable input

customer_reviews.title: terrible software
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent device destroyed by cumbersome software. You can't simply wire it to your router to get started but instead it broadcasts a setup network that you must connect with. The interface is slow and clunky as well as the box. 5 minutes to update the firmware? Really? Skip it, there are better options out there for everything that this device does.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall L. Kiker

customer_reviews.title: Won't show all available networks to set up bridge mode
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours trying to set this up in bridge mode. Followed the instructions included but It was not showing all the available wifi networks including the one I wanted to connect to. I could not figure out how to make it show the available networks. Followed all examples on the internet, tried to upgrade the firmware from the Hootoo site and from a link referenced in a review here and could not find it on the referenced page. The review was from 2014 so maybe they took it down. Tried their Tripmate app and it didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: OU812

customer_reviews.title: Great once you get it working with a network
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it, I managed to set it up as a WiFi hotspot, but after unplugging it and moving it, I couldn't get it set up at all. It's still not working. The seller sent me a replacement device and I have configured it and it's working. It's a nice little device that you can plug in anywhere and it picks up the wireless signal from your main network router, after first wire it and configure it. Flip the toggle button to "Wi-Fi" and it works anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Britt Medina

customer_reviews.title: Pros -very portable -provides encrypted network Cons -Can't be configured ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros -very portable -provides encrypted network Cons -Can't be configured to desired frequency range e.g. it couldn't work with my eufy genie alexa device which requires router with 2.4GHZ frequency -Not the fastest router
customer_reviews.author: Kimani

customer_reviews.title: Own Three and is a standard go to gift for friends. Very handy to have.
customer_reviews.text: These little guys are so nice to have. We have 3 of them in our house we use for mobile hot spots. The best use we found for it recently was when we went on a 12 hour road trip with our three kids. We preloaded a flash drive with some movies on it to plug into the HooToo and took it in the van with us. We have 3 kids and each child was able to connect with their own kindle fire's to it and watch whatever movie they wanted to off the flash drive. No arguing from the kids on what movie they were going to watch because they all could watch their own at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Torrey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Slow down the internet speed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and easy setup but it's not the fastest, it really ends up slowing down transfer speeds. If you care about speed and you do streaming do not get this. I measured with and without and this thing drop the speed 80%. Update: the vendor send me a replacement router and the speed is better.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Much More Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two small routers--one to serve as an access point to hotel networks, the other to distribute secure internet to my family when we're traveling (camping & resorts). As it turns out, this tiny device does both! And the Wizard is so intuitive I was able to get it working in my desired configuration within 15 minutes of opening the box---and while I may be a geek in other areas, I'm a novice on networks. Love it! Update 6/28/18 - for the 1st time, I wasn't able to make this router connect to a hotel wireless. (It did so the 1st time, refused from then on). If this was one-time, no change in rating. Will check back...
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Great little beast, once it is set up!
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is very good, but it does take some setup to get it to work as desired. The setup is not overly complicated, but the instructions are horrible (thus 4 out of 5 stars). DON'T USE THE WINDOWS APP TO SET THIS UP! I tried for an hour on both windows 7 and windows 8 machines and couldn't get it to work. Instead, use the web interface! For instructions, take a look at my blog:  I was successful in setting this little beauty up as a NAS on my network. My windows machines see it as a mapped network drive and my android devices see it using the tripmate app.
customer_reviews.author: speechman

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't sign on to double sign in pages.. now updated 4/12/17
customer_reviews.text: Motel had a double sign in page. Sign in to their page then sign onto internet. This did not do that. waste for this trip Update 4/12/17: Credit to the company, they have contacted me twice to give me instructions on how to use this and left the answer also on this page below this review. Unfortunately, I am not at the motel anymore so I won't be able to try out their solution until I find a similar situation. I'm sure this is the answer, so take this review and decide on the product yourself as to whether is will work for your particular needs.
customer_reviews.author: kids_bus_driver

customer_reviews.title: Pure packaged frustration.
customer_reviews.text: It might be good if you have COUNTLESS HOURS to waste setting it up. The device only works with their software which is slow, clunky, unresponsive and lame. The included instructions are about as useful as reading hieroglyphics in a pyramid. Some people say that they can use ES explorer with it but that has NOT been my experience so far. Just don't buy this thing unless you are unemployed and can spend a week of 8 hour days being frustrated by what seems to be a great little gizmo that refuses to allow you to unlock its potential.
customer_reviews.author: 4dafryguy

customer_reviews.title: Works as an xfinity wifi hotspot extender; price is right
customer_reviews.text: Bought to extend nearby xfinity wifi hotspot to where I occasionally visit. It does the job, though somehow it seems to lose the connection to the hotspot for no apparent reasons -- xfinity wifi is kind of a public hotspot, after all. Considering that, it does a fair job for what I bought it for. It'll be a perfect 5 if it operates more reliably or in a way to tell what causes the disruption. Setup is relatively straightforward if you have some experience in setting up a wireless router. And, price is right :-)
customer_reviews.author: B U

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used this while traveling yet
customer_reviews.text: I have tested this unit at home before going on the road and it works great. Be aware that the instructions they give you on this are wrong. You will likely not find a support page for this and instructions on the USB stick will leave you running in circles, hence the 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this little guy
customer_reviews.text: Love this little guy. Second one I have, I use both regularly. We use it in the car when traveling so the kids can play minecraft PE together over the in-car network. I use the other in my business laptop bag for when I travel to give me a really simple private wifi network. Powers easily off a laptop USB port or portable battery. I have a 10,000mAh battery and I've run it off that for HOURs. There is a version of this with a built in battery, but if you have a portable battery already this will run off it for a long time. Easy to set up and use. Super tiny so it travels very well.
customer_reviews.author: M. WUNDERLICH

customer_reviews.title: Compact, and it works!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to be about the size of my palm, instead it's only 2"x2". To me that is a pro, I need to travel light/compact, so the smaller the better. File transfer to and from an attached USB to my iPhone and my Android worked perfectly. I'm deducting a star for the shoddy and out of date documentation. For iPhone the documentation recommends an app called "HooToo Tripmate" with a wifi symbol as its icon. HooToo has released new software called "HooToo TripMate Plus" with a cloud icon that is much more user friendly, and has worked better in my experience. Overall, it does everything it claimed. -1 star for the bad documentation and iffy software.
customer_reviews.author: TwixTurtle

customer_reviews.title: Upgrades Your Chromecast Device
customer_reviews.text: We bought the device to use with the 1st Generation Chromecast as the Chromecast device does not feature a web browser which made it incompatible with the Karma Go HotSpot. It also save us a monthly fee by not getting their Premium feature to have a protected SSID broadcasting so that it would now work with the Chromecast. There is newer device (with a battery included) but I prefer this one as I can leave it powered on/charging all the time. The newer model states that keeping it charged all the time is not recommended so that means you may have your connection dropped out if the device is not close to monitor and recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for chromecast tv
customer_reviews.text: Works great and exactly what I needed. I like to use my chromecast tv and share internet with a lot of other people in hotels and rv parks. It is perfect to create my own network so my tv can be hooked to it and not shared with everyone. Also great for hotels when you have one login but multiple devices
customer_reviews.author: barefootchick

customer_reviews.title: Not a wireless to wired bridge
customer_reviews.text: Claims to be able to act as a bridge but it can't. Only provides wired to wireless or wireless to wireless. Not wireless to wired which is what a bridge is normally used for.
customer_reviews.author: BillyBobJimboBob

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Router; Cannot Use as a Wireless Access Point for Another Router However
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping I could use it as a wireless access point that used the same SSID as my existing network and allowed my existing router to assign the IP address. Unfortunately, it doesn't work like this. If this device is used as a wireless access point, it operates as a router and distributes IP addresses to the connected devices. It will not allow my existing router to assign the IP addresses. (Caveat: if you are willing to flash custom firmware, etc., then there may be a way to configure it the way I wanted; this was too much work for me). That said, it is a great travel router.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Simple and inexpensive way to get wifi access to a wired network
customer_reviews.text: The wifi coverage for my bedroom was terrible but I had an ethernet port with internet access built into my wall. The ethernet port wasn't going to get my smartphone on the network so I bought this. Ran a cable from the wall port to the HooToo wireless router, powered it up using a spare phone charger, and configured it using the instructions in the package. Now I have perfect wifi reception and internet access on my own private wifi network without the expense and hassle of a full size router. It's been working great for about six months now I haven't had to mess with it or reboot it once.
customer_reviews.author: J. Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Must have item for travelers.
customer_reviews.text: If you travel often then you need this little guy. You can set the WiFi up to mirror your home network (name and password), then take it with you wherever you go. All you will need to do is plug it into a hotels Ethernet port, or connect it to your hotels wifi network and all your devices will automatically connect to it and will have shared Internet. There is even a handy iPhone app for easy set up. I use this with all my devices, including a Roku Streaming stick, when I'm traveling. Now I can stream my movies to the big hotel TV. Best of all, it's tiny so it's easy to travel with anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: F Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet little device. I use it for work to set up a bunk network or remote desktop into PC's that dont have monitors. Im able to log into the GUI and see the client list and their IPs. I'm probably using this for different reasons than most but its great for what I'm doing. super small and light weight too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE TINY DEVICE SOLVES WORLDS PROBLEMs
customer_reviews.text: I could write so much on this device but just go read the manufactures page. Because this tiny little thing does so many things it's crazy. Wifi extender wifi router wired router wifi gateway portable personal cloud Storage private network server for small class I guess. Media hub I didn't get a battery pack but pickup one of those for 10 and your set. Great for traveling or if your like me and screwed up buying an iPhone 6+ w only 8 gb ram then you need this for your media files or you'll be running out in no time. Ps I know it's 16 gb but after the crooks install 8.1.2 pretty much what your left with
customer_reviews.author: John_geez

customer_reviews.title: ... rate this higher because when it worked it was perfect. But what happened is it died on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this higher because when it worked it was perfect. But what happened is it died on my first trip out. I couldn't tell you if it was me or the device. The idea and ports are perfect. Easy to configure and flexible either using the wired port or wireless to connect to the outside world. Customer service is awesome. Sent me a new unit and it works perfectly. You can create your own cloud, use the ether port to stream a movie or wirelessly. Very configerable and easy to use. Also provides power for that one time you used just a little too much battery on your trip and you need a quick recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Rondeau

customer_reviews.title: Good Router for Dorm Use
customer_reviews.text: I set up this router as a bridge to my school’s WiFi so I could set up some Sonos speakers and a smart plug. So far everything works great, but a few things to consider: 1) It cuts out periodically which requires restarting it. Idk if it’s because the school WiFi isn’t reliable or because it’s not supposed to be left on all the time, but either way it’s annoying. 2) There is a noticeable decrease in internet speed if you’re using it as a bridge. Often connecting directly to the dorm WiFi will yield a faster connection.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Gillett

customer_reviews.title: Great for hotels
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this item to use at a hotel with wired ethernet. Unfortunately, the hotel I was at only had wifi. Fortunately, this router worked GREAT to allow me to stream with my Chromecast. I have found in the past that Chromecast will not work with hotel wifi that has a login screen. This router allows you to bridge the wifi of the hotel, and use this router as the wifi connection. It is not effortless, I did have to continue to login to the hotel wifi whenever I used the Tripmate Nano, but I was able to watch Netflix on the tv through my Chromecast, instead of on the tiny screen on my phone. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: M K

customer_reviews.title: Well then, information is money 💰
customer_reviews.text: After initial set up, it's been working great. Now I am able to connect my TV, Roku, and fire stick to my xfinity hot-spot. Of course the internet speed drops from time to time but if you have many users from same provider near you, you'll be fine. I've been able to stream movies on my TV with ease. Whoever came up with this idea did good :) Take your time to set it up and follow the instructions. You can later change the network name like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny.

customer_reviews.title: Bricked and support was no help. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to upgrade the firmware on this product following the instructions on the website. At some point the upgrade failed. I tried to reset the unit using the reset button. That also failed. I then contacted customer support detailing what I had done and that the unit was not sending out a signal and that the units WiFi (blue) light would come on solid for a seconds and the flash continuously. In the reply I was told to reset the device and upgrade the firmware via the app. This was impossible and did not work. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Stuart

customer_reviews.title: this is a great wifi to wifi bridge
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!!! Went to MICRO CENTER and they swore up and down that this is not possible. Scenario: Lets say you have a business or whatever and you use XFINITY HOTSPOT (or any existing Wifi). With this device, you can connect to Xfinity Hotspot and do configuration on computer WITHOUT having to use wps. Once this device is connected to Xfinity Hotspot, it will emit a new wifi signal!!!! this is a great wifi to wifi bridge. This means that all of your GUESTS can connect to internet using tripmate nano Wifi and you never have to give out password to Xfinity Wifi!!!! This product is a must have!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ubachukwu O.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this because I needed to create a secure ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I needed to create a secure wifi network when connected to a hotspot (xfinitywifi). Most routers do not allow for a pop up on a web page. This device allows for it, however the signal it gives off is so weak it doesn't connect to anything. I purchased another device and it works perfectly. I can now stream on a secure wifi network I created off of a hotspot. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just remember this is not standalone  a router or modem!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Strong Construction and good quality - Sleek elegant design - small and can be tucked away, hidden, but is very functional. - Light yet powerful - Comes very well packed - Comes with manufactures extended Warranty when you register your product. Cons: - None If you liked my review and was somewhat helpful, please click "YES" on the button below and let others know! Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Ramez

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: It connected with my HP desktop, but I couldn't get it to work with my Dell desktop. I bought a Ravpower Filehub for a few bucks more from the same company. It has worked with no problems. This HooToo has been relegated to the basement overflow box.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as TP-Link portable router, but works well
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Compared to TP-Link N300 which I purchased at the same time this one has less throughput so I prefer the TP-Link product but this also does the job and is flexible. Nice interface allowing you to customize the router settings. Tried using as a wireless extender to boost signal of another router but that didn't seem to work for me. I gave up on that after multiple tries. Like the fact that it can use USB for power, which is great for portability. Downside is low throughput, so not for heavy lifting of any sort but nice gadget to have on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great personal router, especially for Chromecast in Hotels
customer_reviews.text: Great personal router, very easy to set up and use both wired and wireless (as a repeater bridge). I especially like to use it in hotels, where I plug my chromecast in to the TV, then stream from my phone or laptop directly or from other services. I've also used it to read flash drives from my tablet, which works great (admittedly, one flash drive I had didn't fit, but every other one has). It even runs well off a portable battery pack, when I don't want to deal with plugging it into an outlet or a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the RavPower Filehub, and it messed up my hard drive and I had to wipe it and reformat it and put my files on it again. This problem put me in the market for something better. I decided on the HooToo to run my 2.5" 1TB HDD for DLNA. I am very pleased to say this works beautiful for DLNA aka streaming content from a network hard drive, if you aren't familiar with DLNA. Anyway, it works great. I'm so glad I bought the HooToo. I will for sure buy their updated models in the future as well, as they are released.
customer_reviews.author: lickenhaffenfillypassenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel router. I use this in my SUV with my amazon fire stick and a hard drive for local movies. The HooToo router is a great way to setup a LAN when you are traveling for 8-12 hours with the kids, it provides several uses. 1 - it allows my children to stream the content on my hdd to their ipods/phones whenever they want. 2 - it allows my children to play Minecraft or other games from their ipods/phones on a local game while driving. 3 - I also use this at work from time to time to for file sharing when we are in a remote office.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted_to_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t support my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to bridge between a public network and some of my devices in my apartment. Unfortunately, this device doesn’t support two-level authentication which is what I needed. So, I can’t speak for how it works for anyone else but it doesn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Broadie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.  Simple.  Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could set up my own WiFi network in a hotel room, with a password instead of a splash screen (so I could use my Chromecast). 1. Set HooToo up as a bridge, connected to hotel WiFi. 2. Connect to HooToo network with tablet/phone/laptop. 3. Navigate to an http (not https) page -- get the hotel's splash screen. Sign in. 4. Set up Chromecast on HooToo network. 5. That's it! Connect as many devices as you want to your HooToo network, and they can cast to the chromecast. 5 min to set up and everything just works.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Compact Travel Wi-Fi Access Point
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Hootoo for over a month in our office as a rogue access point and it has worked great out-of-the-box. I will buy another one to insert into a laptop stand project I am planning. The initial setup was simple and it can be managed, with very little effort, using a smartphone or laptop.Although it's intended as a way to provide wireless connectivity in hotel rooms where there is only an ethernet drop, with a little imagination, it can be applied in a variety of situations.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel router!!!
customer_reviews.text: Interesting device. A travel router for wireless, and other options can be bound with new software. Essentially, it is an inexpensive router - at least that is the mode I tested. Is a neat piece of electronics, inexpensive enough to play with, or use on the road without hauling large pieces of equipment with you, and worrying about someone stealing it. It has a web page interface (just like the professional routers) for setting things up, or updating with new software - that can be downloaded from their website. It also can be used with a USB drive and configured with central shared storage if you wish, similar to cloud storage for your group.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McHugh

customer_reviews.title: Good, but it's slow and requires firmware update to be usable
customer_reviews.text: I use this for creating a wireless bridge when traveling to secure my devices. This is great for that, but it cuts download speeds in 1/4 on average, so this is not the best solution for multiple devices streaming media at the same time. The firmware update process is also a bit complicated, and it's required to support the initial authentication to the hotel's WiFi. That was especially annoying the first time I tried to use this and I couldn't update the firmware with the supplies I had.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with  MacBook 12, My Passport Ultra 3TB & Seagate Slim Drive 2 TB formatted for ExFat
customer_reviews.text: IT WORKS GREAT. Just a little background for people who may be having similar problems, this is a solution :) I have a MacBook 12 and running El Capitan it does not read external hard drives unless you reset the SMC 2-3 times. 2 Genius Bar Visits & 2 repairs later and nothing to do but keep doing the resets. I desperately looked for a solution and found this little machine. It works great. I have everything formatted to ExFat and it reads my thumb drives and My Passport Ultra 3TB & Seagate Slim Drive 2 TB. I am traveling soon and this is a life saver. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Charrlie

customer_reviews.title: Does not read Apple Mac format drives.
customer_reviews.text: The router is small which is great. The interface is clunky but the HooToo website was helpful. However I have a Macbook and we wanted to connect an Apple Mac formatted drive. It doesn't do that. You can only hookup Windows formatted drives. This router is useless for what I need it for. My rating is based on using on my PC and phone which was fine.
customer_reviews.author: michele K

customer_reviews.title: In Love on Day One
customer_reviews.text: This little gem is the best piece of tech I've purchased since my last MacBook. Super easy to set up a hidden wifi network with security - the directions are slightly incomplete but if you know anything about wifi networks you're probably going to be OK. Used my Kindle Fire for the setup, no issues. I can't speak to this product's longevity, but right now I've got all my devices connected to blazing fast internet and I couldn't be happier. This thing paid for itself in about 10 seconds. It would be a bargain at thrice the price. In other words - buy it now before something bad happens.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for travel, in air and on ground
customer_reviews.text: Working great. In air as we speak. Able to log in to Gogo inflight via the HooToo to that network and sign in and then share with family of 4. Hesitated to purchase as I was afraid I’d need my laptop along but works great accessing the HooToo via safari on iPhone and the supplied address per instructions 10.10.10.254. We’ll worth the $20!
customer_reviews.author: yepitsmn

customer_reviews.title: Decent portable router, website/manual needs update
customer_reviews.text: I wish the USB device was accessible via ftp instead of an app on android. Would of been nice if tech support updated their website to reflect the screenshots from the current app on Google play. The icon on Google play does not match the icon depicted on the website/manual. Overall it does the job it's supposed to do if you want to extend range or share another internet connection.
customer_reviews.author: A. Macatula

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: After hooking up to use as a router and configuring it to my preferences so I could use when traveling. When testing it I couldn't even open a single page. I tried with an Iphone, Ipad, and a wireless computer some of which couldn't connect. Doesn't work I feel ripped off. Avoid this company.
customer_reviews.author: exterminator

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this unit
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but I encountered an SSID with a trailing space character (I know that's odd) that I could not connect to with this router. I was able to connect to that SSID with all my devices and laptops, but it took me a while to figure out why it never worked on the router. The SSID showed up and I could enter the credentials, but apparently the web interface strips leading/trailing space characters from the SSID, causing the connection attempt to fail every time. Other than that I've been very pleased with this unit. I haven't used the USB port to share media, I have only used it to share upstream wifi connections.
customer_reviews.author: TomBl

customer_reviews.title: Instant Signal
customer_reviews.text: This was a BIG help when I was living on campus. The Wi-Fi they had was terrible and was always losing connection in the middle of me doing homework for hours at a time. It was very difficult in the beginning getting it set up, but once I figured it out with some help, I had an instant connection as long as I had an ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: Imani

customer_reviews.title: WiFi booster failed, security ?
customer_reviews.text: This item may work for some but not for me. I got this only for its repeater function, boosting a weak WiFi signal. It failed to boost WiFi signal. It makes hard drives and thumb drives wireless but exposes your files to anyone with the password, the psswd can be changed if you know how, did not try. Anyone can get the factory password by reading the reviews. It works well in other functions but I did not try moving files or opening them. Android tablet. Update, fast customer service after review posted, change psswd using website, they send link. Why not in instructions? No solution to repeater function. New unit in production coming.
customer_reviews.author: MSvendsen

customer_reviews.title: Too slow
customer_reviews.text: Video was intermittent. From 4TB USB powered drive to HooToo viewed on a 12.9" iPad Pro. Play started then picture broke up, restarted broke up. Unwatchable.
customer_reviews.author: Eureka First

customer_reviews.title: My Apple TV works! But quality control may be an issue.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars for the device, subtract one star for the quality control. First one I purchased never extended a hotel network. I was frustrated but assumed it was the network configuration more than the TripMate. An attempt during an extended stay at a different hotel had the same result. I contacted HooToo and they quickly sent a replacement (2 days to Hawaii). The replacement works but frequently drops the wifi and we have to re-login in a connected device. Other devices (iPhones, iPod touch, Kindles, and iPads) don't require login as frequently, so I am assuming theTripMate is the culprit. But it is still passable to extend the network to our Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: mattyfaulk

customer_reviews.title: My fiancé can’t live without this router
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé says this does its job perfectly and that he doesn’t know what he would do without this router! He somehow uses it to connect his Nintendo Switch to the internet. He spends most of his life in hotels and is required to use a landing page to login to use the internet, however, the Nintendo Switch doesn’t have browser capabilities. He tried everything to get connected but nothing else worked and he says this didn’t give him any trouble at all —its worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. The original needed a firmware update and I did that and it still didn't work so they sent me another one. I asked for them to send me a better version and the company says they wouldn't do it. They sent me the same product and it still needed a firmware update. I updated it again and the new one didn't work either. So I am going to buy with another company, one that will actually work .
customer_reviews.author: Z G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: OK, this is an amazing product, especially for the price! Basically, it's a WiFi router, complete with a web interface! The micro USB connector is only to provide power to it. The RJ-45 connects it to a cable modem (directly, or through a switch), or you can slide a switch on the device and connect it to an existing WiFi connection for more security. It does take some configuration via the web interface, but that's painless as long as you remember to set the slide switch for wired or wireless (for the internet connection you want the device to use).
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Really amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is the real deal. It just works. I like how you can use a simple USB cable to just power it up (from your laptop). The apps to manage it are nice. For family trips, just load up on movies and you can use this as a hub to stream. Also, I use this device as a WiFi connection point for development, so one can go beyond entertainment use and into more technical use-cases. Only thing I don't like is that if you leave it unpowered for a full day, it loses its memory, so you'll have to setup the WiFi credentials again.
customer_reviews.author: Jee Vang

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up breaking the antenna slot off of my pcie wireless mini card, and I'm afraid to use my laptops Gigabit card to replace it after how badly I put on the antenna caps. So I broke out this little devil I planned to use for hotel stays and it delivers. I use it to connect my bad range router to it, and it connects to my actual router for a little more than double the speed. It's very shy from my Gigabit card, however, it's not connecting to the 5 band internet so I can't ask for too much. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Xedhadeaus

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I loved the size and weight, but that's where it ends. I was able to make it work quite fast but then it's just not consistent. Most of the time it connects to the internet, but after a few minutes I just don't have internet so have to switch to the hotel's network. I tried two hotels and it's pretty consistent in not working sometimes in both cases. In an instance it did work, I was able to surf the web but not watch a video (Apple keynote) - switch to the hotel's native network (the same one the HooToo was connected to) - worked instantly. I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Works Great/Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Great little router. Bought for a family trip to very nice resort. For some reason the nicer the hotel the stingier they are with Internet access. This allowed all our phones and gadgets to share a single wireless access code. I set it up with the same SSID as my home so everyone connected without my having to play tech support. Easy configuration, menus are straightforward and it just worked. Any technology that just works as advertised each and every time you need it to gets high marks from me.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you travel and need to bypass the hotel login screens
customer_reviews.text: Perfect if you travel and need to bypass the hotel login screens. I use this 2 ways. I have tethered this to my cell phone and 2) tethered to the hotel WiFi. With the hotel Wifi login screen, you may need to grab the IP address for the network gateway and plug into your browser. Chromecast connects without issue. Speeds will slow down, but Netflix, Youtube stream just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Patel

customer_reviews.title: Feels Cheap and Buggy
customer_reviews.text: This was difficult to configure, and I suspect buggy software and/or hardware is to blame. This thing is tiny, but feels cheap. It worked out of the box with the default settings, but once I started changing the default network settings and passwords, it would require several hard reboots before the changes would take effect and the device would become usable. I quickly realized this was going to be more trouble than what it was worth, so returned it. I have since purchased as similar product from a name-brand manufacturer, and was able to configure and use with ease.
customer_reviews.author: A.N.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to setup an AdHoc network for my smart phone and PC for a specific purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of its popularity on amazon. I wanted to setup an AdHoc network for my smart phone and PC for a specific purpose. (An app on my pc acts as UPnP server to smart phone client - I need a portable/mobile solution - since I don't know what kind of network I'll be near). The marketing hype seemed to indicate it would work. Unfortunately it does not meet my needs. That's because it has *very* limited configurability. If you need to setup DMZ or Port Forwarding this unit is NOT for you. Screen shots of the configuration screen would have eliminated this product as one of my choices.
customer_reviews.author: DBL

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to setup. Just loaded a thumb drive with movies and plugged it into the HooToo and now the kids are all set for road trips. Only con is the app isn't the best but once you get it figured out it isn't a big deal. On some of the tablets we have the app would try to make you sign into the router interface every time you start it. Once we learned to just hit cancel everything was fine.
customer_reviews.author: TFournier

customer_reviews.title: Bad support and bad software
customer_reviews.text: Bad support and bad software. Their IOS app is so outdated even Apple warned against using it. Of course it did not work. All my settings did Not stick. It make me reboot after making changes. Then after reboot I do it again and again. I would find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on our trip. It was cool that my younger girls could watch a different movie than my oldest son at the same time in the car. The only minor issue we had was when my younger son wanted to connect with his old windows phone we couldn't because the app was not made for windows phone OS. I'm not sure if it was because his phone was too old (3+ years) and the app wasn't available for that version of windows mobile or maybe the app isn't available for windows mobile at all. I hope to see compatibility in the future for all mobile OSes.
customer_reviews.author: gellegbs

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for every frequent traveler who cannot live without their Chromecast!
customer_reviews.text: This router is on of the most useful travel item I have bought in years! Any hotel that has an HDMI port and a free wifi connection allows me to use Netflix using my Chromecast. It was a little tricky to set up at first, but after a couple failed tries, it works like a gem without slowly down the wifi connection at all. On top of its usefulness, its size is perfect for traveling; you can fit it in any small compartment in your backpack or suitcase and almost forget it is there. 100% awesome product!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith S

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power in a little package!
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectation in many ways. Everything stated in the description it achieved and it did so with ease. I am surprised at the reception this little device has and the fact they somehow managed to implement an antenna that reached far around my home, inside and outside. I have used it both as a router and as a Wi-Fi extender. Before 1 places a review they should simply do a couple of searches on Google or any search engine on how to set up devices for different uses. I will definitely the watching this company and their brand from now on as I have marked it in all of my buying notes.
customer_reviews.author: J MacPherson

customer_reviews.title: Only works with internet
customer_reviews.text: It might work if you were to hook it to a router, but trying to configure it statically in a simple LAN doesn't seem to function. So if you're not connecting to the internet, or are trying to connect an ethernet device to a WiFi device, don't bother. I've updated the review because the seller was helpful, and refunded my purchase without being asked. The restrictions on the device still stand - you cannot bridge from wifi to ethernet - but for a sub $20 wireless AP, you wouldn't expect it to do everything.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rose

customer_reviews.title: If you travel, you need this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy router! I have used this at work, in hotels, and once in the hospital. It turns any wired network in to a wireless network. I love it. I set it up to the have the same name/channel/password as my home network so my Google Chrome, laptop, and phone all connect to it seamlessly. I am really surprised this is not more expensive. No more crappy hotel room cable! I can watch whatever I want and connect wirelessly. It also has great range for its size. I have not done distance tests, but it works everywhere in my house.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. King

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Device
customer_reviews.text: I own a RavPower to use wih my ipad and it works, but not as well as I would like. The biggest problem is the constant disconnecting and dropping the connection. I saw this device, TripMate Nano and decided to give it a try and the price was great. I have to say so far this is a great little product and so far no connection or drop issues. You have to use the right apps to get the most out of it. I use Hoo Too TripmMate Plus, Remote File Manager,Ace Player,,AirStor and OPlayer with mine. With a combination of these apps the Hoo Too works great! Very simple device and works!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless right now
customer_reviews.text: This device is unstable and does not save the settings which I have put into the unit. Totally useless right now. Planned to use this to test a product which I wanted to use via wifi but it seems to not be suitable for even limited use.
customer_reviews.author: SGI

customer_reviews.title: Update the firmware before using.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it failed just outside of warranty. I used it maybe 10 times while traveling. --Update: Manufacturer replaced it for free even after warranty expired. No hassle, simply emailed them and explained. Revised rating (previously 3*) to 4* based on customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Staci Thurston

customer_reviews.title: reboots at random
customer_reviews.text: technically functions, but it reboots about once an hour so all my devices like the laptop and chromecast get kicked off the network and streaming breaks. I got this to chromecast in Hotels with captive portal, and it doesn't work well enough to watch a movie so I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: ASCII Aardvark

product_meta.title: HooToo Wireless Travel Router, USB Port, High Performance- TripMate Nano (Not a Hotspot)
product_meta.description: The TripMate is the only mullti-use gadget you need when traveling, and complements your active tech lifestyle. As a portable device, the small size hides three very different but very powerful features. Whether that means charging your mobile phone on-the-go, creating your hotspot or sharing files with the family, the TripMate is perfect for anytime, anywhere use.
feature_bullets: TRAVEL ROUTER: Instantly convert a wired network to wireless with easy setup. Also can bridge an existing wireless network, create your own secure Wi-Fi network
FREE UP SPACE: Backup your photos and videos from your iPhone, Android phones, iPad or other mobile devices to attached USB flash drive, hard disk. Free up space on your phones
ENDLESS MEDIA STREAMING: Seamlessly stream your videos, photos, and music to your connected TVs, media players, Chromecast, Roku and other DLNA devices
LIGHTWEIGHT AND SMALL: Powered by USB for extreme portability, which is only weighted 1oz
PACKAGE CONTENTS: HooToo TripMate Nano (HT-TM02) , USB cable, User Manual, 1 year HooToo warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars2,474 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #401 in Computer Routers#42,695 in Computer Accessories & Peripherals
